pr_title: Add rca config classes for unbalanced node rca and young gen rca

timeline.message: Add config settings for unbalanced node RCA
add config settings for young gen rca

timeline.bodyText: Should we just call the class OldGenRcaConfig ?
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: The reason I use this "HighHeapUsageOldGenRcaConfig" as the class name is because I want to keep it consistent with the actually RCA class name which is "HighHeapUsageOldGenRca".
replies.author: rguo-aws

timeline.bodyText:
I think it would make more sense to just pass the rcaConfig object to the constructor and have it read the config from it.
Similarly for the OldGenConfig
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.message: made some changes based on PR comments

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think we need a GenericConfig and then its inherited classes. The json structure inside rca-config-settings is similar for all types.
Maybe it would be less code, if we just have a a ConfigHelper class that initializes with RcaConf object and then specific RCAs can ask for a value given a string.
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText:
done. removed the inheritance and add the below function to retrieve value mapped by (rcaName, setting name ) key.
public  T readRcaConfig(String rcaName, String key, Class<? extends T> clazz)
replies.author: rguo-aws

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can add java doc comment describing the params ?
